meanings.definition: To install (a monarch) on a throne.
meanings.sent1: The king's subjects gathered to enthrone him on the grand throne.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony to enthrone the new queen was filled with pomp and tradition.
meanings.sent3: The royal cat tried to enthrone itself on the throne, much to the amusement of the courtiers.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen piece can enthrone itself as the most powerful on the board.
meanings.sent5: The act of enthroneing a ruler symbolizes their authority and power over the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The ancient ritual was meant to enthrone the tribal chief as the leader of the community.
meanings.sent2: The constitution enthroneed the president with the authority to make important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The magical amulet was believed to enthrone its wearer with mystical powers beyond imagination.
meanings.sent4: The legendary sword was said to enthrone its wielder as the rightful ruler of the land.
meanings.sent5: The crown symbolizes the responsibility enthroneed upon the monarch to rule with wisdom and fairness.

meanings.sent1: The loyal subjects helped enthrone the young prince on the throne after his father's passing.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor carefully enthroneed the statue of the goddess in the temple.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous court jester tried to enthrone a duck on the throne as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The ancient prophecy foretold a hero who would enthrone the lost queen back on her rightful seat.
meanings.sent5: The throne room was adorned with jewels to enthrone the ruler in a setting of grandeur and opulence.
